text: Luigi Fontana Russo (Trapani, January 15, 1868 - Trapani, 1953) was an Italian economist and lecturer. == Career == Since 1907 he taught trade policy and customs law at the University of Rome. It was part of the school luzzattiana. From 1913 to 1919 he was Rector of the Royal Institute of Business Studies and Administrative Sapienza University of Rome. From 1928 he taught economic policy.Luigi Fontana Russo in Dizionario Biografico – Treccani He continued teaching until 1938. He was also President of the Bank of Italy.Raimondo Cagiano De Azevedo, La Facoltà di economia: cento anni di storia, 1906-2006, Rubbettino, 2007, pagina 215 He organized the Federation of Italian owners. ==References== Category:Italian economists Category:1868 births Category:1953 deaths
